plugins.name: Pride Flags & Gradients
plugins.description:
Simple pride flags and colors via gradients.


Show the pride in your designs. The filled-in shapes are fully resizable, rotatable, and editable, without distorting the gradients.


At the moment, the plugin contains these gradients:


  • Pride flag
  • Trans flag
  • Subtle trans
  • Nonbinary flag
  • Subtle NB
  • Bisexual flag
  • Subtle bi
  • Pansexual flag
  • Asexual flag
  • Subtle ace
  • Lesbian flag
  • MLM flag


As of August 27th 2022, the plugin is open-source; the code is available on its GitHub page, and you're free to contribute new flags, gradients, or even wholly new features.

plugins.name: psd.to.design ‚Äî by ‚Äπdiv‚Ä∫RIOTS ‚Äî Import any Adobe Photoshop file (.psd, .psb) to Figma
plugins.description:
Convert any Adobe Photoshop (.psd) document into Figma designs.


Import your Adobe Photoshop (.psd, .psb) files into Figma as designs with fully-editable layers, or as pixel-perfect images.


All files are kept 100% private on your local machine and never sent to any server. We never see your documents.


How to import a Adobe Photoshop (.psd or .psb) file into Figma:

  1. Drag-and-drop or upload your .psd or .psb file into psd.to.design plugin.
  2. Select how you want to import your file: as editable layers or static images.
  3. In a few seconds your file will be converted into editable Figma designs!


Why use psd.to.design?

  1. Extract images and text from your Adobe Photoshop and get them straight into Figma.
  2. Keep your Photoshop layer in Figma.
  3. Iterate from existing .psd or .psb designs in Figma.


Key features

  1. Convert Adobe Photoshop (.psd, .psb) files into fully-editable Figma layers.
  2. Replace missing fonts.
  3. Supports text styles like colors, weights, sizes etc.
  4. Import vectors, ready to be edited in Figma.
  5. Vector clipping masks.
  6. Vector strokes.
  7. Imports all layers including hidden ones.


------------------------------

Brought to you by ‚Äπdiv‚Ä∫RIOTS

üí¨ Chat with us

------------------------------

plugins.name: Getillustrations Icons, Illustrations and 3D Design Assets
plugins.description:
Access a Library of unique Hand-Drawn Vector Assets ‚Äì Updated Weekly!


The Getillustrations Figma Plugin brings the entire illustrations bundle to your Figma workspace, including all new weekly updates with fresh icons and illustrations. Our assets are fully hand-drawn from scratch, crafted through years of market research, and shaped by client feedback, establishing us as a trusted authority in the world of unique and high-quality vector assets. With over 11 years in the industry, we are dedicated to providing designers and creators with unparalleled quality and innovation in every style.


Key Features:

  1. Expansive Asset Library: Access Thousands of illustrations, icons, 3D graphics, and stickers in various styles and categories, with new additions every week.
  2. Quick and Easy Search: Find assets quickly with our powerful local search, filtered by style, category, free or premium access. Getillustrations ensures a fast and intuitive browsing experience so you can focus on creating.
  3. Limitless Customization: Easily drag and drop assets into your design, with full vector editing options, including color and size adjustments. Designed to adapt to your needs, each asset maintains its quality across any customization.
  4. Fully Integrated with Figma: No need to switch tools‚ÄîGetillustrations is seamlessly built into Figma, enabling you to browse, preview, and use assets directly within your design environment.
  5. Hand-Drawn Uniqueness: Our illustrations are one-of-a-kind, developed from scratch based on years of client feedback and research, making each style distinctive and tailored to current market needs.


Why Choose Getillustrations?

Our dedication to originality and quality has made us an industry leader in illustration and icon design. With Thousands of assets and continuous weekly updates, you‚Äôll always find fresh assets for your projects. The Getillustrations plugin offers both free and premium options to suit any design requirement.


What Users Are Saying

"A fantastic library of high-quality illustrations that bring projects to life. It‚Äôs user-friendly and comprehensive." ‚Äî Lucas Diab

"The styles are diverse and perfect for my work. It‚Äôs my go-to for unique and well-crafted illustrations." ‚Äî Julian Colina

"An essential tool for designers! The organization and variety make it a top resource for any creative project." ‚Äî Joe Taylor


FAQ:

  1. What license do I have on these assets? You have a Standard Commercial Usage License with unrestricted use in your or your clients‚Äô designs. There are no limitations on views or projects.
  2. What does the plugin offer? Free users enjoy access to high-resolution free illustration packs. Paid users unlock the entire library without restrictions or download limits
  3. Do I have to create an account? Yes, logging in connects you to the Getillustrations library. Signing up is simple and can be done via Google for a seamless experience.
  4. What about free sets? Free sets and low-quality assets are available with https://www.getillustrations.com/. Premium users have unrestricted use without attribution.
  5. More questions? Reach out to our support team via the chat widget on our website for additional help.


Unlocking Full Access:

As a free user, you gain access to low-resolution PNGs for all our assets, with high-quality images available for free sets. To unlock the entire library, simply upgrade on Getillustrations.com and link your account. Once upgraded, you‚Äôll instantly have full access to all assets in high resolution right within Figma.


Experience the power of Getillustrations in Figma ‚Äì where creativity meets quality. Join thousands of designers who rely on our assets to bring their projects to life.

plugins.name: Pantone Hub
plugins.description:
Pantone Hub is your go-to tool for exploring and converting Pantone colors in Figma. Easily browse Pantone libraries or match your custom colors to their Pantone equivalents.


Color Picker:

  1. Choose a Pantone library of your choice.
  2. Browse through the complete list of colors from the selected library. Hover over any color to view its details.
  3. Click on a color to insert it as a token directly into your Figma canvas.
  4. Alternatively, select objects (e.g., rectangles, frames) on your canvas, then click on a color to apply it directly.


Color Converter:

  1. Select a Pantone library to search for matches.
  2. Input a HEX color value to find the nearest or exact Pantone match.
  3. The closest matching color will be displayed.
  4. Click on the color to insert it as a token into your Figma canvas.
  5. Alternatively, apply the color directly to selected objects (e.g., rectangles, frames) on your canvas.

accepted.name: mohan vadivel
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.tagline: Find, Access, Explore, and Convert Pantone Colors with Ease.

plugins.name: Blue Pencil
plugins.description:
Maintain formal design specs with markup based organization and content generation features.


Current Features

  • Frame Tidying
  • Frame Numbering
  • Frame, Page, and File Name Injection
  • Last Modified Date
  • Table of Contents Generation


Usage

Most of the features of this plugin rely on a layer name including specific markup such as {framename} that controls how content is updated. Other features such as the automatic frame arrangement are more passive and help keep the document organized.


The plugin has a UI that provides preferences for each feature and shows the markup needed for each. The plugin may also be run using the "Revise" command which skips the UI but uses the most recent settings from the UI.

accepted.name: Riley
accepted.description: UX Designer at SAS

plugins.tagline: Markup based design spec maintenance.

plugins.name: figma codegen
plugins.description:
Unlock the full potential of your design and development process with the Figma CodeGen Plugin, a state-of-the-art tool designed to seamlessly bridge the gap between UX designers and software engineers. This plugin leverages the latest in AI through ChatGPT-4, enhancing the automation of converting Figma components into executable code, including HTML tags, CSS classes, and instance directives.


Key Features:

General Settings: Streamline your workflow with customizable settings that allow you to set prefixes and establish masks for properties, CSS class names, and directives. Use placeholders that automatically fetch values from your design tokens to ensure precision and consistency across all your components.

Component-Specific Customization: Each component can be individually tailored with specific settings to meet its unique requirements. This feature enhances component adaptability and ensures your design's fidelity is maintained when translated into code.


  • Advanced Integration with ChatGPT-4: By integrating with ChatGPT-4, the plugin offers expanded capabilities in code generation, providing you with intelligent code suggestions and optimizations directly within Figma.
  • File-Level Configuration: Maintain consistent settings and ensure uniform code generation across your team by saving configurations at the file level. This promotes effective collaboration between designers and developers, making your workflow more efficient and reliable.


Get Started Today

Embrace a streamlined, integrated design-development workflow with the Figma CodeGen Plugin. Ensure your design system is flawlessly translated into precise web component code. üöÄ

General Settings: Streamline your workflow with customizable settings that allow you to set prefixes and establish masks for properties, CSS class names, and directives. Use placeholders that automatically fetch values from your design tokens to ensure precision and consistency across all your components.

Component-Specific Customization: Each component can be individually tailored with specific settings to meet its unique requirements. This feature enhances component adaptability and ensures your design's fidelity is maintained when translated into code.


  • Advanced Integration with ChatGPT-4: By integrating with ChatGPT-4, the plugin offers expanded capabilities in code generation, providing you with intelligent code suggestions and optimizations directly within Figma.
  • File-Level Configuration: Maintain consistent settings and ensure uniform code generation across your team by saving configurations at the file level. This promotes effective collaboration between designers and developers, making your workflow more efficient and reliable.


Get Started Today

Embrace a streamlined, integrated design-development workflow with the Figma CodeGen Plugin. Ensure your design system is flawlessly translated into precise web component code. üöÄ

plugins.name: Sequential Text
plugins.description:
Sequential Text populates a range of text layers with a numeric sequence.


To use it, select the appropriate text layers, launch the plugin, enter the text that you want to appear in the first layer in your selection, then press Update Text. The plugin automatically identifies the suffix, how it should increment, and updates all the selected text layers with appropriately sequenced text.


It supports simple numbered suffixes, or more complex ranged suffixes with different separators.


Here are some examples of what a range of text layers would contain for a given input string.


Pattern: 1

Output: 1, 2, 3, 4, etc.


Pattern: Label 1

Output: Label 1, Label 2, Label 3, Label 4, etc.


Pattern: Faders 1-8

Output: Faders 1-8, Faders 9-16, Faders 17-24, Faders 25-32, etc.


Pattern: 1/2

Output: 1/2, 3/4, 5/6, 7/8, etc.


Pattern: 1 & 2

Output: 1 & 2, 3 & 4, 5 & 6, 7 & 8


Figma does not guarantee the ordering or layers in a selection, so you can choose how the plugin applies the sequence across the selcted items: in rows or in columns depending on the position of the layers.


Limitations

It does not support sequential prefixes. You‚Äôll get odd results if you try to use labels that begin with numbers as the plugin thinks the following text is a range separator. I may change the way the sequential elements are identified to be less automagical, and more explicit.

accepted.name: Henry Bourne
accepted.description: Experience & Design @ Lawo

plugins.name: Wavy
plugins.description:
Generate dynamic SVG waves on the fly

Craft stunning and dynamic SVG waves for your projects in seconds. Take your pick from three distinct wave styles: classic and smooth spline waves, sharp and edgy square waves, or the regular graph waves. Further personalize your waves with two different patterns - create a consistent flow with the periodic option, or embrace a more organic touch with the random pattern.


Unleash your creative control

Fine-tune every detail for precise control. Adjust the frequency to control the distance between wave peaks, and the amplitude to modify the wave's height. See your creation come to life in real-time with the live preview. This allows you to experiment and iterate until you achieve the perfect wave for your needs.


Seamless integration

Once you're happy with your masterpiece, easily add it into your web designs with a simple button click. SVG export ensures your waves look crisp and beautiful at any size, without sacrificing quality.
plugins.tagline: Level up your visual storytelling with dynamic SVG waves!

plugins.name: list breaker
plugins.description:
List Splitter is a Figma plugin designed to help you easily split list items into individual text layers, while retaining the width of the original text box. This plugin allows you to keep the same design style across list items and adjust the spacing and layout with precision.

Instructions for use:

  1. Select a text layer containing a list. Ensure that the list items are separated by line breaks.
  2. Run the List Splitter plugin from the Plugins menu.
  3. Click the "Split list items" button.
  4. The plugin will create individual text layers for each list item while maintaining the original width and design style.

Key Features:

List Splitter is a Figma plugin designed to help you easily split list items into individual text layers, while retaining the width of the original text box. This plugin allows you to keep the same design style across list items and adjust the spacing and layout with precision.

Instructions for use:

  1. Select a text layer containing a list. Ensure that the list items are separated by line breaks.
  2. Run the List Splitter plugin from the Plugins menu.
  3. Click the "Split list items" button.
  4. The plugin will create individual text layers for each list item while maintaining the original width and design style.

  • Split list items into individual text layers
  • Retain the original width and design style of the text box
  • Adjust spacing and layout with precision

With List Splitter, you can easily manage and style your lists without the hassle of manually creating separate text layers for each item.

plugins.name: Icon sprite generator
plugins.description:
What does it even do?

Creating an SVG sprite for a set of system icons can be kind of difficult and often involve stringing multiple services together to achieve the desired result. So this is the problem this plugin aims to solve. One place to target, optimize and export a bunch of icons as one unified SVG sprite.


How to use?

The UI is broken up into a few different blocks, each with it's own impact on the SVG output.


// Target method

The target method is the way in which you specify which frames/icon you want to be included in your SVG sprite.


Current selection - This method allows you to manually select the individual frames you want to be included in the sprite output.

Layer key - This method allows you to specify a key word that may be included across multiple layer/frame names and will target every node with key word as a part of its name.



// Symbol colour

Every icon set is different and you may want your icons to be a specific colour, or to inherit their colour from their context, or you might just want to not specify a colour at all!


Inherit colour - Will use "currentcolor" in place of path and fill colours.

Custom colour - Allows you to override any existing path/fill colours with a custom hex/rgb/hsl.

Unset - Does nothing at all with the symbol colours!



// Symbol dimensions

By default the dimensions are set to the most common icon size (24px by 24px), which is also the current best practice for icon sizes on the web. The width and height can be changed to whatever you so desire and this will update the symbol "width" and "height" properties, as well as the SVG viewBox.



// Optimization

To help with SVG path spaghetti, you have the ability to optimize your SVG output. This can be configured and is achieved by using the open source SVGO optimization library.

accepted.name: Ethan Roxburgh
accepted.description: Senior Product Designer @ Fathom

plugins.tagline: Easily target, optimize and export layers as a custom svg sprite.

plugins.name: Universal Hyperlinker
plugins.description:
Description:


Transform your Figma design elements into interactive portals with the Universal Hyperlinker! This tool enables you to instantly turn shapes, images, or frames into clickable hyperlinks, facilitating seamless navigation within your design files. Experience real-world web interaction right on the Figma canvas.


Features:


  • Broad Element Support: Hyperlink shapes, images, or frames effortlessly.
  • Batch Hyperlinking: Accelerate your workflow by linking multiple elements simultaneously.
  • User-Friendly Interface: Our intuitive UI makes hyperlinking quick and straightforward.
  • Flexible URLs: Enter either full URLs or just the domain part‚Äîboth work flawlessly.
  • Versatile Interaction: Hyperlinks remain clickable on the canvas, in prototypes, and in PDF exports.
  • Dynamic Clickable Areas: Hyperlink regions automatically adjust to your object's dimensions.


Ideal for designers seeking efficiency, Universal Hyperlinker is the ultimate plugin to create interactive, navigable mockups that mirror actual web functionality. Activate clickable links in your designs and elevate your prototyping process with Universal Hyperlinker.

accepted.description: UX obsessed designer, making tools and resources for other designers.

  • Broad Element Support: Hyperlink shapes, images, or frames effortlessly.
  • Batch Hyperlinking: Accelerate your workflow by linking multiple elements simultaneously.
  • User-Friendly Interface: Our intuitive UI makes hyperlinking quick and straightforward.
  • Flexible URLs: Enter either full URLs or just the domain part‚Äîboth work flawlessly.
  • Versatile Interaction: Hyperlinks remain clickable on the canvas, in prototypes, and in PDF exports.
  • Dynamic Clickable Areas: Hyperlink regions automatically adjust to your object's dimensions.

plugins.name: Link spacing variables
plugins.description:
Effortlessly link spacing variables to your design system, ensuring consistency and efficiency throughout the design process.


Depending on the scope you define for each variable, auto-layout spacings, width, height and corner radii can be linked.


How it works:

  1. Create a collection: Start by creating a collection that contains all your spacing variables (e.g. xs, sm, md etc.). Make sure you set the right scope for each variable.
  2. Select the layer(s): Choose the layer(s) in your design that you want to link with the spacing variables.
  3. Run Apply spacing variables command from the plugin menu. If it's your first time using the plugin, it will prompt you to specify the collection that holds the spacing variables. No worries - we'll save that selection.
  4. Automatic linking ‚ú®: The plugin will automatically link all selected layers and any nested layers that utilize autolayout to the corresponding spacing keys in your collection.


Spacing variables won't be linked to nested instances: The plugin ignores nested instances of components within your selected layer(s) to prevent accidental overriding of values. You still have the flexibility to manually override values by explicitly selecting individual instances or layers within an instance.


Ensure the frame's mode matches spacing collection to apply correct values: If your spacing collection offers different modes based on viewport widths (e.g., desktop or mobile), it's crucial to ensure that the frame you're working on is set to the appropriate mode. This way, the plugin will apply the correct spacing values according to the chosen mode. Learn more about modes for variables.


Changing spacings collection: To change the spacing collection, simply navigate to the Apply spacing variables > Settings.


Github page

plugins.name: Mandala Maker
plugins.description:
Mandala Maker allows you to craft intricate mandala patterns from your own designs. It offers adjustable settings for segment count, element spacing, design rotation, and overall mandala size. You can also incorporate additional layers of complexity by adding an additional layer. 


Usage:


  • Select a vector or shape and load the plugin. 
  • Use the "Symmetry slider to adjust the number of symmetrical segments.
  • Modify the ‚ÄúInner-Layer Spacing‚Äù and ‚ÄúOuter Layer Spacing‚Äù sliders to control the density of your design.
  • Change the Rotation Angle slider to set your orientation.
  • Check the ‚ÄúAdd Second Layer‚Äù box if you desire an additional layer of complexity.
  • Opt for ‚ÄúApply Size‚Äù Variation to introduce random variations and an organic feel to your mandala (The output will not be symmetric, but will display depth when number of segments are higher.)

 

Generate Your Mandala:

Once satisfied with your settings, click the Generate Mandala button to create your custom design.
plugins.tagline: Craft intricate mandalas from your own designs with ease: shape, rotate, size, and layer!

plugins.name: FigSheets
plugins.description:
FigSheets creates a spreadsheet for generating designs, right in Figma. It'll help you create and store multiple versions of a design without the error-prone copying and pasting OR detatching instances when you need to change one keyword or layer.


Using FigSheets is simple:


1. Create a sheet; specify the number of layers, keywords, or entire blocks of content you want to swap out of a template.


2. Add your Master Template to the "MASTER" cell (the blue tabbed cell). This is the design you'll create alternate versions of.


3. Add the layers, content, or keywords in the appropriately labeled red-tabbed cells.


4. Add the "Override" information in those red tabs. When you "Sync" the sheet, FigSheets will look for the layer names or keywords to create new versions of your Master.


5. Hit "Sync!" Alternate versions should appear like magic.


Tip: If you want to generate Components, just make your Master Template a Component or Instance. The components will inherit the name of the Master Template and append the text in the purple "RESULT" tab (which you can rename).

accepted.name: Will Berger
accepted.description: UX/UI Designer at Capital One

plugins.name: Sprout UI - FREE Figma Web UI Kit Component Library
plugins.description:
Welcome to the Sprout Plugin!

We‚Äôre thrilled to introduce the Sprout Plugin‚Äîa powerful Figma component library that merges the best of SproutUi, Blog Sprout, Shop Sprout, Wire Sprout, and more. This plugin is designed to revolutionize how you design, offering a one-stop solution for building stunning, scalable user interfaces. Whether you're crafting websites, eCommerce stores, blogs, or wireframes, this plugin brings together everything you need in one place.


What‚Äôs Inside?

The Sprout Plugin combines over 1300 unique components from multiple UI kits and design systems, organized into 20+ categories, including Navbar, Hero, About, Services, Blog, Portfolio, Pricing, Testimonials, FAQs, Contact Forms, and much more. It also comes with 250+ ready-made pages for various use cases like Home Pages, Blog Pages, E-commerce, Portfolio, and even wireframes‚Äîgiving you the tools to tackle any project.


Thank You for Your Support!

This plugin wouldn‚Äôt be possible without the incredible support of our community. Your feedback, enthusiasm, and input have been invaluable, and we‚Äôre excited to see what you create with the Sprout Plugin.


Why Did We Create the Sprout Plugin?

In today‚Äôs design landscape, efficiency and consistency are key. We created this plugin to help designers keep a unified approach across diverse projects‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs a blog, an online store, or a corporate website. By combining multiple design systems, we‚Äôve made it easier for you to maintain a cohesive design language, reduce redundancy, and save time.


Key Benefits of the Sprout Plugin


All-in-One Solution: Access a complete set of design components for multiple project types in one plugin‚Äîno need to switch between libraries.

Seamless Workflow: Prototype, iterate, and design faster with pre-built, fully customizable components.

Consistency Across Projects: Maintain a consistent design language across different platforms like WordPress blogs, WooCommerce stores, and more.

Collaboration: Enhance teamwork by using standardized components that both designers and developers can easily work with.

Scalability: Whether it's a small blog or a large eCommerce store, the plugin adapts and scales effortlessly with your project‚Äôs needs.

WordPress Integration: Like SproutUi, this plugin is designed with WordPress users in mind, ensuring smooth integration into your favorite themes and page builders.

100% Autolayout: Built entirely in Figma‚Äôs Autolayout, it ensures your designs remain responsive and flexible for different screen sizes.

UiChemy Compatibility: This plugin works seamlessly with UiChemy for quick Figma to WordPress conversions, supporting Elementor, Gutenberg, and Bricks.


What‚Äôs Next for the Sprout Plugin?

We‚Äôre constantly evolving! Here‚Äôs what you can expect in future updates:


Enhanced WordPress Integration: Smoother workflows for WordPress designers and developers.

More Blog Components: Additional templates and components to power WordPress blogs.

Expanded Wireframe Templates: Helping you kickstart projects with wireframes right inside Figma.

WooCommerce Support: More components and pages dedicated to building eCommerce stores.

Portfolio Enhancements: Extra design options for showcasing portfolios beautifully.


Need Help?

For any questions or support, reach out to us at support+wpsprout@posimyth.com. We're excited to see the amazing designs you'll create with the Sprout Plugin!


Explore More

Check out our website at sproutui.com to discover more about SproutUi and our other design solutions.


Also, take a look at our other products:


UiChemy: Convert Figma designs to WordPress with ease (uichemy.com).

Nexter WP: The Gutenberg website builder you‚Äôve been waiting for (nexterwp.com).

The Plus Addons for Elementor: A complete toolkit for Elementor with over 120+ widgets (theplusaddons.com).

WDesignKit: Simplify WordPress website creation and collaboration (wdesignkit.com).
